intro: Heudelotia africana, commonly known as the African heudelotia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough, textured surface. Heudelotia africana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
